docs.lead_paragraph: New Hampshire -- forty-third of the forty-eight states in area, forty-fourth in population -- has sent one native son to the Presidency (Franklin Pierce, Democrat, 1852), and another to the Vice Presidency (Henry Wilson, Republican, Grant's ticket, 1872).

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31 -- L. G. Cox, director of technical projects for the Beech-Nut Packing Company, told the special House committee investigating the use of chemicals in food products today that his company had spent $668,000 in the last six years keeping residues of new pesticides out of baby foods and peanut butter.

headline.main: FOOD MAN DEPICTS FIGHT ON PESTICIDES; Tells House Group Firm Spent $668,000 to Purge Baby Items and Peanut Butter

docs.abstract: L G Cox repts Beech-Nut spent $668,000, '46-52, to keep residues out of foods
